solution_line_template: In {years_in_future} years James will be {james_current_age}+{years_in_future}=<<{james_current_age}+{years_in_future}={james_age_in_5_years}>>{james_age_in_5_years} years old
So in {years_in_future} years Matt will be {james_age_in_5_years}*{age_multiplier}=<<{james_age_in_5_years}*{age_multiplier}={matt_age_in_5_years}>>{matt_age_in_5_years} years old
That means Matt is now {matt_age_in_5_years}-{years_in_future}=<<{matt_age_in_5_years}-{years_in_future}={matt_current_age}>>{matt_current_age} years old
